content:
Tommy and Mark were lying on the floor of Tommy's bedroom, the time portal watch resting between them. They had just returned from their trip to the past and were still reeling from the experience.

"I can't believe it," Tommy said in a hushed tone. "I never knew him like that. I never knew he had to go through all of that."

Mark nodded silently, letting his friend talk through his emotions.

"I mean, I always knew he had a tough time growing up," Tommy continued. "But seeing it firsthand, it's just so different."

Mark placed a reassuring hand on Tommy's shoulder. "I know, man. It's a lot to take in."

Tommy took a deep breath and sat up, running a hand through his hair. "But you know what? I'm glad we did it. I'm glad I got to see him like that. It helps me understand him better."

Mark sat up as well, the time portal watch still resting between them. "Yeah, I know what you mean. And we got to see what it was like back then, too. It's crazy how different things were."

Tommy nodded in agreement. "It really is. But you know what? It's also made me realize how lucky we are. We have so much more than they did back then."

Mark smiled. "Yeah, I guess you're right. We're pretty lucky to have all the stuff we have."

Tommy picked up the time portal watch, examining it closely. "I still can't believe we actually went back in time. It's like something out of a sci-fi movie."

Mark chuckled. "Yeah, it's pretty wild. But we have to figure out how to get back to the present."

Tommy's expression turned serious. "Yeah, we do. I don't want to mess anything up by being gone too long."

Mark stood up, stretching his arms. "I think we just need to activate the watch and concentrate on going back. We did it once, we can do it again."

Tommy nodded, standing up as well. "Okay, let's do it."

They both picked up the time portal watch and concentrated on returning to the present. The watch began to glow brightly, enveloping them in a blinding light.

When the light faded, they found themselves back in Tommy's room. Everything was exactly as they had left it, but everything felt different. They had a newfound appreciation for the present and a deeper understanding of the past.

Tommy looked at Mark, a smile spreading across his face. "We did it. We really went back in time and met my dad when he was our age."

Mark grinned back at him. "Yeah, and we got back in one piece. I call that a win."

Tommy laughed, feeling lighter than he had in a long time. "Yeah, definitely a win. Thanks for coming with me, man. I couldn't have done it without you."

Mark shrugged. "No problem, dude. Anytime you need me, I'm there."

They high-fived each other, feeling like they had just accomplished something great. The time portal watch lay forgotten on the floor, a small reminder of their incredible adventure.

As they lay back down on the floor, Tommy knew that he would never forget this experience. It had changed him in ways he couldn't even begin to understand, and he was grateful for it. He closed his eyes, feeling content and at peace.

The end.
